chapter.title: Initial Project Setup
chapter.para: This chapter will get you started with the initial setup of a MyAdmin based project.

section.title: Project creation
section.para:
To create a new project fire up the new project dialog via NewProject MyAdminNew MyAdmin project.
The Organization Name and Project Name basically describe you base project package names and paths. For example when you enter org.example as your Organization Name and Project1 as Project Name the root package path for all your projects will be org.example.project1
After clicking finish MyAdmin creates its basic default project structure which will be explained in the next section.

section.title: Project layout
section.para: The default MyAdmin project setup consists of six different projects that are automatically created on initial project setup.

section.title: Server test project
section.para: JUnit tests for the server as well as everything needed to set up a local web container and automatically deploy the application to it.

section.title: Client project
section.para: Code for the client side. As the client code is later compiled using the GWT compiler it is very important to keep in mind that GWT compiler only emulates a subset of the Java runtime library. If a JRE class or method is not supported, the compiler will emit an error.

section.title: Client test project
section.para: JUnit test for the client, for the source code the same limitations as in the client project apply.

section.title: Build project
section.para: Ant scripts to compile and package the projects.

section.title: Deploy project
section.para: Ant scripts to compile and package the projects.
